H0.text: As a behavioral adaptation, the increased virulence of Brucella abortus when exposed to light—an effect that causes fever in humans—is described.

H1.text: As a survival disadvantage, the increased virulence of Brucella abortus when exposed to light is described.

H2.text: The increased virulence of Brucella abortus, which causes fever in humans, when exposed to light can be described as a response to a stimulus.

H3.text: As an acquired characteristic, the change in virulence of Brucella abortus when exposed to light is described.
